alert.note: Alert for Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:26PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Ada, western Boise, southwestern Valley, central Payette, Canyon, northwestern Owyhee, Gem, southeastern Washington and east central Malheur Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 426 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms with an outflow boundary along a line extending from near Granger Butte to near Letha to near Adrian to Twin Springs Campground to near Red Butte. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Emmett, Homedale, Wilder and Greenleaf around 430 PM MDT. Caldwell, Eagle, Star and Middleton around 440 PM MDT. Nampa, Meridian, Horseshoe Bend and Gardena around 450 PM MDT. Boise, Kuna, Garden City and Banks around 500 PM MDT. Crouch, Rockville, Diamond Butte and Bogus Basin Ski Area around 510 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley
